document_data.name: Mashida Kowa
document_data.mainbody: '''Mashida Kowa''' was a [[korobokuru]] [[samurai]] and retainer of the [[Goshukara clan]] in [[Nakamaru]] in the 1770s on the [[Wa Calendar]].
document_data.Activities: Because of both his skills and his heritage, many considered Kowa an ill-begotten upstart. Regardless, he tried to live according to [[human]] customs and was very sensitive about racist offenses.
document_data.History:
Kowa was born and raised in the wooded mountains outside Nakamaru but for his qualities he was adopted by the [[Mashida clan]]. With them, he trained as a [[samurai]] and a very promising future.

In {{YearlinkConvert|1777|WY}}, [[Oka Yoshinaka]] and Kowa clashed with the Gamo brothers [[Gamo Hidenobu|Gamo]], [[Gamo Mitsutoshi|Mitsutoshi]], and [[Gamo Mochikuni|Mochikuni]].
